<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 15"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Legendary Sneak](/Feats.aspx?ID=807) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 263 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Legendary in [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15); [Swift Sneak](/Feats.aspx?ID=850)

</column>

---

You’re always sneaking unless you choose to be seen, even when there’s nowhere to hide. You can [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62) and [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63) even without [cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459) or being [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4). When you employ an exploration tactic other than [Avoiding Notice](/Actions.aspx?ID=511), you also gain the benefits of Avoiding Notice unless you choose not to.
name: Legendary Sneak
